reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?
reply.analysis: The privacy policy states the app collects data, indicating the declaration of data collection.
reply.reference: This app collects analytical data on how individuals interact with the solution. Additional information can be found directly in the app URL: https://www.clearful.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects data such as email addresses, journal entries, and any other information users provide.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions the types of data collected by the app, including email addresses, journal entries, and information provided by users.
reply.reference: The data collected includes email addresses, journal entries, and any other information users provide. URL: https://www.clearful.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?
reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that users can opt out of data collection or delete data by uninstalling the app and contacting support for data deletion requests.
reply.reference: Users should keep in mind that if they choose not to provide certain data, some features of the app may be limited or unavailable. At any point, users can uninstall the app; refer to the information provided in the app on how to make use of data subject rights, including deletion requests. URL: https://www.clearful.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with third parties such as analytics providers, hosting providers, and payment processors.

extended_simple_answer.content: analytics providers, hosting providers, payment processors
